head.title: World Briefing | Environment: Czech Republic: Exemptions For Chemical

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Environment: Czech Republic: Exemptions For Chemical

abstract.p: United States and several other nations meeting to discuss Montreal Protocol are given permission to continue use of methyl bromide through 2006 despite ban that is to take effect on Jan 1; chemical pesticide is thought to be harmful to ozone layer (S)

block.p: At talks on the Montreal Protocol, which restricts chemicals harmful to the ozone layer, the United States and several other countries gained permission to continue using substantial amounts of methyl bromide through 2006 despite a ban that is to take effect in wealthy countries on Jan. 1. The chemical destroys ozone but is a popular weed and pest killer. American officials said the exemptions were only for farmers or other businesses with no affordable substitutes. Environmental groups argued that the move was mainly aimed at pleasing voters in farm states and would delay the development of safer substitutes.
